drupalNodeEvent.title: China-Latin America and the Caribbean: Infrastructure, Connectivity, and Everyday Life

field_speakers.processed: José Manuel Salazar-Xirinachs (former International Labour Organization), Enrique Dussel Peters (Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México), Diana Castro Salgado (Universidad Andina Simón Bolívar), Yang Zhimin (Institue for Latin American Studies-Chinese Academy of Social Sciences), Ravi Madhavan (University of Pittsburgh), Thomas Rawski (University of Pittsburgh), Jevon Minto (Red ALC-China), Celio Hiratuka (Universidade Estadual de Campinas), Omar Narrea Rivas (Universidad del Pacífico)

field_organizers.processed: Asian Studies Center, University of Pittsburgh, Center for Latin American Studies, University of Pittsburgh, Red Académica de América Latina y el Caribe sobre China, Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México

field_description.processed: Participants from the United States, China, Brazil, Chile, Ecuador, Mexico, Jamaica, and Peru will analyze China's impact on everyday life in Latin America through an analysis of infrastructure projects and immigration. Day One will cover infrastructure projects.
